snippet: Ted Cruz defeated David Dewhurst, the candidate favored by Gov. Rick Perry, in a vote for the Republican Senate nomination.
abstract: Former Texas solicitor general Ted Cruz, an insurgent backed by the Tea Party, defeats Lt Gov David Dewhurst, the candidate favored by Gov Rick Perry, in a runoff election for the Republican Senate nomination in Texas; outcome reveals a wide rift in Texas between the party establishment and restless anti-incumbent activists on the right.
lead_paragraph: Ted Cruz defeated David Dewhurst, the candidate favored by Gov. Rick Perry, in a vote for the Republican Senate nomination.

headline.seo: Cruz Defeats Dewhurst for G.O.P. Nomination in Texas Senate Race
headline.main: Tea Party Favorite Wins Texas Runoff
headline.print_headline: Tea Party Favorite for Senate Wins as G.O.P. Pick in Texas
